Reviews.Title: “Checkpoint Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hammers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided on a Capital City Break and having chosen Berlin as our destination, with the help of Trip Advisor we decided to stay at the Hotel Angleterre. We read about 10/12 reviews regarding the hotel and all were very positive, so we took the plunge and booked in for 4 nights in April. We were not disappointed in either Berlin or the Hotel. The Hotel location is spot on Checkpoint Charlie, which during the cold war, formed a very significant part of Berlin's more recent history. We had a small but spotlessly clean room on the 5th floor which of a night was wonderfully quite as this hotel is positioned slightly away from the more active part of the city. However the local underground station (line U6) is literally across the road and from there you can travel anywhere within Berlin's historical city. We included the breakfast in our booking and with a mixture of hot and cold food, along with fruit and cereal, was more than adequate for any palate. The staff are astute, helpful, intelligent and very informative regarding Berlin's tourist hot spots and lucky for us spoke perfect English as our German leaves a lot to be desired. We never actually had an evening meal in the hotel however the menu look extensive and the price was reasonable for a City hotel, with even a two for one offer over the weekend. We both enjoyed our visit to Berlin and if we ever returned would have no hesitation in booking the Angleterre again. Lastly if you have time, spend a few hours in Potsdam which is about an hour away from Berlin by train (line S7). A wonderful German historic town on beautiful lakes and rivers, very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “exellent choise for Berlin”
Reviews.Author: BergenNorwayJog
Reviews.Content: just got back from a 4 nights easter trip to Berlin. flew to schønefeld airport..( old airpot... but the new one Brandenburg is opening in may) took the S- bahn to friedrichstrasse station( ca 30 min) and a taxi from there to Angleterre hotel. ( lot of traffic , better off taking U-bahn to Coch station which is right outside the hotel) very friendly staff at hotel. got a suite #114... clean ,very spacious rooms, with two 42 " flat screens & bathroom brand new....top notch.the room faced the street and had ok view..did the breakfasts across the street, all good. (hotel breakfast was 17 euro per .person, and we paid 1/3 of that). hotel Bar "die bar" was nice & good service..checkpoint charlie just down the street, we took the hop on/off bus one day , but this was so so.. could`nt hear the guide.. no earplugs but speaker ...noisy engine from the bus. take the U-bahn or just walk to typology of terror, & brandenburger tor & reich tag. visited Berlin zoo.. do this if good weather...lots of shopping possibilities in potsdamer platz..would recommende this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is near!”
Reviews.Author: Nata1982
Reviews.Content: Well everything is really near :) Undeground station, cafes (that's why we didn't take breakfast in the hotel - cost nearly 16 euro - whereas in oppisite to the hotel cafe good breakfast was 6 euro). To the museum island by food (if you dont like metro) near 20-25 min - you go accross shops, small museums, restaurants (very pleasant hiking). Very much recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aleksey_spb
Reviews.Content: We really glad that we choice you. If we come back in Berlin - we try to stay again with you. Free Wi-Fi, daily free mini-bar, great location near Checkpoint Charly on Fridrichstrasse.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: KerryFused
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Angleterre Hotel last week (29 Jan - 1 Feb, 2012). It is in a great location - literally a 2 minute walk to Checkpoint Charlie where you can hop on tourist buses (if that is your thing) and the U Bahn Station of Kochstrasse is just across the road. If you turn right outside the hotel towards Checkpoint Charlie and along Friedrichstrasse you'll head up towards some nice shops (all closed on a Sunday) and the large Friedrichstrasse S Bahn. Turn left out of the hotel and you can head to Kreuzeberg for the edgier independent stores, cafes and bars but jumping on the U Bahn will get you there much quicker. The hotel is nice, clean and unfussy. We didn't really have much interaction with the hotel staff other than check in and out but they were pleasant. Breakfast was great; one day was continental with a great selection of cheese, meats, cereals, yoghurts and fruits. The other days there was also a hot breakfast too. It is buffet style and certainly sets you up for the day. The rooms are quite plain and also unfussy but importantly they are spotlessly clean. Nothing fancy pretty basic but we were only in them to sleep as were out exploring the rest of the time. Totally recommend the hotel for a couple of days exploring Berlin - great location and a cracking breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Borracha
Reviews.Content: We just spent 2 nights at Angleterre Hotel . Hotel is really close to Check Point Charlie, 400 meters far from Topography of Terror , 700 meters far from Jewish museum… others Berlin’s tourist attraction are not so far but as last weekend temperature in Berlin was -16 degrees it was "hard" to walk so we used “city circle tourist bus” that brings you basically everywhere ( it cost 22€ for 2 days ticket) and during winter is a great transport option. Hotel is clean, quite and standard rooms are big enough (with 40 inches flat TV and free wi fi). Breakfast costs 17€ but we had just coffee and cake at Starbucks just 1 block from hotel. Minibar (just soft drinks) was included in our booking. Taxi ride from Tegel airport to the hotel cost around 20€ and takes about 20 minutes. So hotel is not really centrally located but during spring/summer could be a good options even if you have to walk a little bit to join all Berlin attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good base in super city”
Reviews.Author: JulieHFM
Reviews.Content: (+ means 'like', - means 'not like', = means 'average') + great location near checkpoint charlie en near subway + spacious room + value for money if you don't take the breakfast + staff hotelbar = cleanliness = beds = staff hotel -- price of breakfast is ridiculous, tip: for breakfast go to diner across the street

Reviews.Title: “Nice building, quiet place, poor service”
Reviews.Author: AlexanderY
Reviews.Content: Have stayed there 5 days in 2011 fall. Generally acceptable but would not recommend. Location is central but far to walk to many attractions (e.g. Unter den Linden) and from the rail station as well (which is the cheapest option to get from the airport). The room was clean and generous with size but the view was gloomy. So was the hotel staff we contacted during the stay. On arrival they have lost our luggage left at early check-in. When found no help was offered to bring it upstairs to the room (we had 5 bags for 2 people to carry). Receptionists (except 1 girl) spoke poor English and were unfriendly. The forgot to tidy up the room for 2 days consequently, even after I have reminded to do so. Cant assess the breakfast - we havent tried it beacuse cheaper options can be easily found in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A (good) surprise when you reach your room”
Reviews.Author: Grayontheroad
Reviews.Content: The outside shows the old, classic front of an early 20th century German hotel (and a little soot). The lobby keeps with that theme, but the rooms are new, bright, modern and large. The hotel is right next to a U-Bahn stop (and just a few blocks from Checkpoint Charlie) on Friedrichstrasse (the old caberet street of the 1920's). The caberets are gone, but new department stores and shops line the street as you walk north. Everything we wanted--Christmas markets, opera, ballet, dining, museums--was either a short walk or a quick subway ride. A quiet, comfortable hotel well located and fairly priced.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms, shame about the fitness suite and sauna, I was told by reception better to go to Fitness First”
Reviews.Author: Augustbreak
Reviews.Content: The rooms were spotless, and spacious. I booked a single room and got a huge double bed. Complimentry mini bar re stocked daily is unsual, and a nice suprise. Bathroom was huge, included a bath, heated towel rails and shower, it looked brand new. Ordered room service once at a charge of 3euros 50. Service was excellent, but menu very limited.No breakfast option. I intially booked this hotel because i wanted a hotel with gym facilities during my stay. The website says the hotel has fitness facilities and a sauna onsite. On my first day I tried to access both the fitness suite and the sauna and both were locked. When I asked at reception, is there a gym? I was told yes, but its locked, you need a key and there is an extra charge. He then asked me if I wanted to look. I asked if there was a treadmill or any cardio machine, and the guy just shook his head and said "no no no, its not very good". I expalined that I had a fitness first membership, and he told me I would be better of going to the local fitness first as "facilities much better". Bit disappointed as I could have booked a lot of other hotel for the same price with these facilites. Staff otherwise generally friendly and helpfull. Rooms definitley worth the money. Internet access was free, although only one computer. Location was perfect. Right on top of check point charlie, a U ban station, and the tour bus pick ups. Def value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great package deals”
Reviews.Author: FredMac
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the perfect location for our stay in Berlin as we were walking and using public transport only. Big clean rooms, comfy beds and the staff were really helpful. We found it was a quiet area at night but had enough local restaurants to keep us going. Perfect for sightseeing too.

Reviews.Title: “well located, comfortable but rather impersonal”
Reviews.Author: oxforduser
Reviews.Content: This is a nice four star hotel in an excellent location by Checkpoint Charlie and easy access to the sights. Behind the lovely original facade stands a rather characterless building. The bar and restaurant are functional while the rooms, which are perfectly acceptable, are of the standard, international hotel type. Rooms are not huge but are quite adequate and clean with decent bathrooms. Service is efficient but not overly friendly. Excellent buffet breakfast (which can also be served in the room) but unexciting menu for other meals (and no meals on Sunday evenings) - there are, however, plenty of other restaurants within walking distance. Overall, this is a great base for a holiday in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “makes you wonder about spy stories”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadsrl
Reviews.Content: This hotel, located very near Checkpoint Charlie, in the former West Berlin, makes you wonder how many spies stayed here in the good old times of the Cold War. Other than that the stay in this hotel is not a very personal experience. It is a nice impresonal business hotel, or at least that was the impression I've got about it. Well located, helpful staff (I was quite annoying in ordering taxis all the time, but they complied with my demands on the spot time and again), good breakfast (but I've seen better in Berlin).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is over booking its nights”
Reviews.Author: TalyasUr
Reviews.Content: I don't know how the rooms are, and how is the breakfast, as I was not able to stay at the hotel althoguh I booked for a night weeks before I arrived. I tried checking in at 21:00 and was told that the hotel is overbooked and I am being transferred to another hotel. it is not a good feeling to be transferred in the middle of the night, and change your plans based on a new location. I must say though that although the experience is unpleasant, the hotel did whatever it could to make it smooth and beneficial. so a free taxi took me to the new hotel, I've got a free breakfast, and also got a free coupon for a taxi that can take me anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: perper78
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel! Great neighborhood. Close to both Kreutzberg, Schöneberg and Mitte. U-bahn station is just minutes away - so are many good sightseeing musts. Got an upgrade on arrival - huge room, cathedral ceiling and marble bathrooms. Paid less than €50 a night. What a catch!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: juno85
Reviews.Content: we ended up in this hotel because the travel company had messed up our reservation for the nearby Winter's Berlin hotel. The style is a bit old-fashioned (wood panelling etc) but the rooms were clean and spacious enough. Bathroom was really nice although i would have expected a bit more in the way of freebies for a 4 star hotel - no shampoo or anything like that, just a soap dispenser in the shower. Breakfast buffet was ok but not amazing. Location is great though so overall very good value for money particularly for a weekend trip.

Reviews.Title: “So good !!!”
Reviews.Author: jaipble84
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in good location, near the underground. Yet it is quiet. Room is nice and clean. It is good value.

Reviews.Title: “A superb location”
Reviews.Author: Dickstrips
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in a very comfortable and quiet room. The reception staff were pleasant and helpful and the restaurant adequate although we only used it once. The best thing was the location just 1 minute away from the Kochstrasse U-Bahn stop. This connected easily to other lines, both U-Bahn and regional e.g. for Potsdam, and to the bus to the airport.It took less than an hour from hotel to check in. The Gendarmenmarkt with the Konzerhaus and a range of excellent restaurants was only 15 minutes walk for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We all loved it”
Reviews.Author: Anne D
Reviews.Content: Perfect location very friendly efficient staff, nice clean hotel. Bar/lounge very good . Staff went out of their way to be helpful. Absolutely superb mini break. My husband, son and daughter-in-law loved it too. Would thoroughly recommend Hotel Angleterre.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel nice location”
Reviews.Author: albertbrussels
Reviews.Content: well situated in the Friedrichstrasze at some 100 meters of the underground station and at some 250 meters from check point charlie. Moreover "unter den linden" and the historical hart of berlin (former east-berlin) are within short walking distance. The hotel is on the front a pre-war building but entirely modernised inside. Rooms are fully equiped and very comfortable. Breakfast is well furnished although served in a noizy and crowded restaurant. Restaurant is not advisable because of the many good other restaurants within the vicinity. Very good address for staying in Berlin for a holiday break. Staff is very friendly and most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “recommended”
Reviews.Author: jwlsTrentham
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal on the Angleterre. It is a four star hotel but we only paid £136 for three nights including an excellent breakfast via DHR. The rooms, while not large, are clean and pleasant - the beds are very comfortable and the bathrooms clean and modern with a good shower and full sized tub. We were upgraded but frankly the difference between our more luxurious room and a standard room was negligible so don't bother.Our room over looked the street, our friends faced the inner courtyard but both were fine. Breakfast is well worth getting up for- don't be too late as there was a queue by nine am. The coffee was good and there was a wide choice of tasty food from the buffet- you'll probably eat so much you won't need the roll you have smuggled out for lunch. The reception staff spoke perfect English and were helpful at all times. The situation is good- three minutes to the tube and four to Checkpoint Charlie. Berlin has come to terms with its torrid past. We visited the excellent display on the Wall, the comprehensive Topography of Terrors and the concentration camp on the outskirts of town. All were fascinating. If you are visiting the camp give yourself plenty of time to get there. The train journey is 50 minutes or so and the buses from the station to the camp only hourly but taxis are readily available and reasonable.You will need at least two hours for the visit. Hire the audio guides, they are excellent. It is quite appropriate that refreshments are not available so go equipped.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel and would definitely stay here again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Meghan0820
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel late and the receptionist told us our room had been overbooked but they could upgrade us to their 3 bed suite for the night and switch the next night if we wanted. Once we got up to the room, we were sure we would NOT want to switch. We had a balcony, heated bathroom floors, the most comfortable bed ever, a flatscreen tv, and large amount of storage. The room was one of the largest european hotel rooms I've ever stayed in. The service was also amazing! We got $10 vouchers per day to spend and we spent them at the bar. The bartenders were very nice and helped us figure out directions and places to go. The hotel was also very close to all major sites and the Ubahn (which goes everywhere). Overall, this was one of my favorite hotels and couldn't have asked for more!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, perfectly located, but it felt cold and unwelcome”
Reviews.Author: Martijn_1979
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close to the metro station and Checkpoint Charlie, which makes it a great place to start your trips from. Our room was nice, with a good bed a nice bathroom, some chairs to sit on and a desk with a television. Although we booked a non-smoking room and there was no ashtray in the room, the whole corridor and the room had this awful cigarette smell. The breakfast is nice (but very expensive) and there are lots of choices. The restaurant itself doesn’t have that much tables so we sometimes had to wait for a spot to have breakfast. Although the breakfast proved different, I always had the feeling that I was the only guest in the hotel, the long dark corridors on the ground floor made a desolate impression on me. The staff was not unfriendly, but I never really felt welcome. No smile or greetings when you enter the building after you’ve been out all day. If you’re looking for a place to sleep while you discover Berlin, then this is a good option because of the nice beds, luxury rooms and good additional services. If you plan to spend more time in the hotel and you value friendly staff, I would suggest looking for a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary hotel. Terrible staff”
Reviews.Author: JoseGuererro
Reviews.Content: We found this four star hotel to be very average. Rooms were small and faced back of hotel. Quite dated decor and carpets needed a good clean. Front desk desk not particularly friendly or helpful. Blonde girl (Eva?) was rude to us on two occasions.. Restaurant staff arrogant as well! While location is good hotel is overpriced for what you get. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This is a very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: oddsocksmerseyside
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this hotel. Was overall very impressed, checking in was very quick, and the receptionist was very friendly. The rooms are a good size and very clean. The location of hotel is fantastic, just a couple mins walk from checkpoint charlie and the underground station is literally right outside the front door. Both Brandenburg Gate and Alexanderplatz are within walking distance from the hotel,it was nice walking along Unter den linden to get to those places. Lots of places to eat, and plenty of shops near to the hotel. The only thing that has stopped me from putting excellent hotel on the review, is the breakfast service, which i feel lets the hotel down. Maybe it was because the hotel was fully booked, but it looked like the staff struggled to keep up with the amount people they had in the restaurant, so food items where not being replenished quickly enough and there always seemed to be a lack of crockery, and i had to ask each morning for cereal bowls. Maybe the management should look at the staffing levels in the kitchen/restaurant which would hopefully sort this out and take some pressure off the staff, so that the hotel clients would be getting a better service. If you don't have breakfast as part of the price you paid for the hotel, don't pay 17 euros it is not worth it. BUT don't let the restaurant service put you off staying here, it is a great hotel and would definately reccomend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nankasp
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great and even included a fantastic daily breakfast! It was centrally located, and very convenient to public transportation. The staff was very helpful. Our room was very clean and comfortable. For a city such as Berlin, I thought this hotel was a wonderful value. It's even walking distance to Entrecote a wonderful French restaurant, especially if you're hungry for a fantastic filet.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: zilbeth2007
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for 2 nights in June 2011. Overall, a good stay. I think we paid about $115/night. Good location right near the Kochstrasse station (U6) stop & walking distance to Checkpoint Charlie. Staff was pretty friendly & helpful with giving us directions, etc. My husband loved having drinks at the bar connected to the lobby area. Can access wifi there too. Few issues: --We could not get our "Free internet" in the room to work. It is not wireless, and the front desk could not figure out why it wasn't working via the cord. We are pretty tech-saavy & could not get it to work, so we had to use the free wifi in the lobby & hotel bar (right next door). --Room was small & a little dark since we faced the interior of the building, but wasn't a big deal since we weren't in there much. --Asked for a wakeup call & they never called (luckily we set our cell phone alarms!) --Showers only have gel dispensers for soap....wasn't sure if it was soap or shampoo, so I asked the front desk & they said it was both? Asked for bottled shampoo/conditioner & they provided it.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice and be WARY.”
Reviews.Author: ajpants
Reviews.Content: Very ordinary for a 4 star hotel. Front desk staff somewhat condesening and unfriendly overall. Good location but rooms very small and dark. Stained carpets in hall and in room. Noticed police presence upon checking out and overheard a very distressed guest who just had his laptop, phone and wallet stolen from his room. So also be mindful of your personal possessions when here. Better yet, choose somewhere else to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: skagan7
Reviews.Content: Hotel was perfect. Excellent breakfast, great location, walk to all sites especially Checkpoint Charlie... Fantastic location... Great value!

Reviews.Title: “overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: warbonsam
Reviews.Content: Stayed very briefly, just one night but was impressed with the hotel overall.We paid 58 euro for a twin room which was spotless, well appointed with a huge tv but you will need to speak german if you wish to watch it! Bathroom was faultless. The location is perfect although we would advise on using the underground and rail which are everywhere because although its central its almost too central ie. lots of major buisnesses in that square mile but tough to find a newsagent or convenience store in walking distance but we only stayed overnight so maybe there could be something in the vicinity.Staff were pleasant and friendly, we also had drinks in the bar next door which belongs to the hotel and it was reasonably priced and friendly also. Air conditioning in the rooms meant you could hear it running outside a little but id rather have it than be too warm at night and thats the only complaint id have(i was asleep in 10 mins anyway)Cant see how this hotel could be beaten for the price and would certainly go back.Couldnt say what the pool or spa were like as we didnt have time to use them.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Mrozek
Reviews.Content: Never wrote a review before, but I had to share that this hotel was perfect. Excellent breakfast, great location, walk to the Jewish Museum or Checkpoint Charlie... Fantastic location... Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: btur72
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Berlin and we had a great time. The hotel is in a fantastic location very close to good restaurants and shopping. Check-point Charlie is literally on the next block and the metro is steps away from the entrance to the hotel which made it extremely convenient when visiting other parts of Berlin. The rooms were clean and well-appointed and this hotel is a great value. We didn’t have the breakfast that is mentioned in all the other reviews as there are many coffee shops close by with inexpensive pastries and hot drinks. 3 days weren’t enough and if our travels bring us back to Berlin we will stay at this property for sure!

Reviews.Title: “It's good. I'd stay again.”
Reviews.Author: everthecritic
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent, lot's to see and do within a walk and the nearest underground station is just a few yards away. The bedrooms are spotlessly clean and well appointed. They are perhaps on the small side but very acceptable. The breakfast is a wonderful selection of the highest quality. The staff are very helpful (I particularly mention the guy with the impressive moustache who is almost a tour guide in himself). I was stranded here one extra night because of the Icelandic ash cloud and grateful for all their help. Thay are mean about the sauna, charging €10 and asking for an hours notice so not surpringly, no-one used it. Stupid of them to make a mess of a detail like that.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great City”
Reviews.Author: 186338travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and even though we arrived early we were given our room without delay. The breakfast was fantastic and was one of the best selections we have experienced on our travels. The location was superb and a short walk to Checkpoint Charlie. The room was comfortable and clean. The huge TV was superb. The only minor point to criticise was that there was no TV for 2 days due to changeover to digital. This would not have been so bad if we had been told but we had to ask reception why the TV was not working and they were not particularly helpful or apologetic.. There could also have been a public display of information regarding the situation of airport disruption due to volcanic ash. It was difficult to keep up to date without having the TV.

Reviews.Title: “They don't try hard enough...”
Reviews.Author: Nadavsmom
Reviews.Content: The difference between a good four-star hotel and an average one is a matter of trying a bit harder. The Angleterre is blessed with a fine location and nice reception staff. Those deserve three stars alright. But where does this hotel go wrong? The rooms are small and decor old-fashioned, and if you get a room facing an inner courtyard you will find it rather dark and depressing despite the vibrant Friedrichstrasse outside. Reading lights, for example, are rather far from bed and not adjustable, so reading by night is almost impossible. Bathroom amenities are limited to dispensers of cheap soap/shampoo. And, worse for a working traveler, wifi is only available in the lobby (for a hefty charge unless you use the one available computer post), and rooms only have an old-fashioned USB cable that did not fit my Macbook. They charge extra for everything: internet at 3 EUR per hour or 15 EUR per day, gym and sauna for 10 EUR, breakfast for 17 EUR. All in all, this hotel leaves you with a sense of a slight rip off. On the up side, reception staff is really nice, and location is very convenient - the Kochstrasse U-Bahn is right at the door, and you can hop on it and get to Under den Linden in five minutes. Checkpoint Charlie is a block away, the highly recommended Topographie des Terrors (on former Nazi headquarters ground) is two blocks away, and the lively Kreuzberg nightlife area or Potsdammer Platz are within easy walk. With so many hotels in the vicinity to choose from, the Angleterre should really be trying harder.

Reviews.Title: “Things you might want to know”
Reviews.Author: HotelCooler
Reviews.Content: Located just a few blocks away from Check Point Charlie, is suitable for touring around this site, hop-on / off the tourist busses and taste the touristic restaurants around. No shopping in walking distance. Few meters away from the metro station to take a train for anywhere around the city. Very nice staff. Most of them speak good English. Good breakfast. Very nice service. Bravo girls! Room service: great and affordable. Bravo chef! Room space: barely comfortable. Laundry service: reasonably priced, except for small items (e.g. socks, underwear etc) The rooms around the atrium proved more quite than expected. The bathroom amenities follow the German standard (of the last decade) i.e. dispenser on the tab wall for all-in-one liquid soap, liquid soap dispenser at the sink. Also found: shower cap, shoe shine, sawing kit, safe . Mini Bar prices as usual: ie. ridiculously overpriced water, affordable alcohol. Smoking rooms are offered. Ask for one. The windows open. Very very soft beds... very very soft pillows... Nice if this is your type. Modest conference facilities. Familiarize yourself with the corridors configuration and exits. The architecture may be confusing. Internet access is available through a media company. €15 / day for Ethernet access at the room. €3 / hour. Absolutely inappropriate for business use. The hotel issued a disclaimer about the service, re-directing the customers to the media company ( that also offers the pay TV etc. etc.) The only English speaking TV stations that you will find is BBC News and SKY News. No way to see something different than news in English unless you pay for €15 for a B or C class movie. You will also find a variety of French, Spanish, Russian etc (and a load of German) channels. Ask for the WiFi network available at the lobby. I am not sure if it is free but the signal is weak. I would return to this hotel ( if I had to stay in this specific area). I would be certainly delighted to dine again at the hotel's restaurant, the "speakers corner". [A message to all the hotels in Germany: Hotels have to realize that access to the Internet is not a luxury item such a porno movie is. Internet access is a commodity like electricity. It should be free of additional charge at all the hotels around the world.]

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gagagaga27
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel in late March 2011. We arrived slightly early so our room was not ready but the reception staff were more than happy to look after our bags until it was ready. The hotel is very clean, rooms nice if a little dated but ideal for a mini break. We booked for "the best room available" which excluded breakfast but included a 10 euro a day per room voucher which we chose to use in the bar before eating out each evening. Breakfast at 17 euro each was a little pricey but if you come out of the hotel and turn right and walk for on a couple of hundred metres there are a few cafes which served a nice breakfast for only 4 euro's - we went there each morning - stayed in the hotel for 3 nights. The hotel is ideally located and close to all sites - the reception staff were always willing to help you and give advice on directions etc - you could not fault them - very polite and efficient. We did not eat in the hotel so cannot comment on the food other than the hotel restaurant looked decidedly quiet when we took a peek one night. We chose to eat near Friederick Strasse station and in particular a very nice vietnamese restaurant which served great food at a reasonable price - 6-7 euros for a main course. Cannot remember thename of it but if you need directions let me know. I would stay in this hotel again - definitely - drinks were a little expensive - 2 beers 9 euro's but came with a bowl of nuts - i guess usual hotel prices - much cheaper away from the hotel but nice to visit the bar for a drink before you venture out for the evening. Friendly staff in the hotel bar too. Top tips - take a travel kettle as there are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room - especially if you do not go for the breakfast option. Also buy the Berlin welcome card at the airport when you arrive it allows free travel for the duration of you stay ie 24 48 or 72 hours depending on what you chose. Also but it at the airport and not on the plane as we did as you have to queue to redeem the voucher the airline sell you - no queue if you just buy it at the airport itself. Not sure how the buses train and U Bahn make their money. We purchased our ticket and it stayed in our bags until we got home. It was not checked even once. Transport system is fantastic and always on time and easy to navigate. Recommend that if you stay in Berlin that you chose this hotel - for price, cleanliness, location and friendly staff. If you have any questions please feel free to ask - I will try my best to help.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and Clean with Beautiful Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Jecka92
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon and it was great. The location is in excellent; right down the street from Checkpoint Charlie. The rooms were very large and the bathroom was updated and very nice and clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful and breakfast was included. One complaint was that wireless internet was not available however, there is a Starbucks on the corner and they do not make you purchase anything to use theirs for free.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally situated for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Edith069
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location for visiting all the main attractions. It is very close to the underground station and right next to checkpoint Charlie. It was very good value for money. The rooms were clean and comfortable but would have liked tea and coffee in room. Because we didn't book breakfast in advance, it would have been €17 each but there is a nice coffee shop across the road. The staff are pleasant and helpful. I would definitely use this hotel again,

Reviews.Title: “Great position, functional room, great breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: PaulnJude
Reviews.Content: Very close to checkpoint charlie, 100m from underground station, good price 4 star hotel. Reception looks ordinary, but rooms are fine. first room with shower was a bit dark and dowdy, but asked for a room with a bath which had external window and was a lot brighter and better. Fabulous breakfast buffet - really nicely done. all in all if you get a good price its well worth it

Reviews.Title: “Stay again.”
Reviews.Author: pbowley Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: First time I visited Berlin and thanks to this great hotel and location I will def be visiting again. Just walking distant from check point Charlie and only a gentle stroll from all the great shops,bars and cafes that Berlin offer. A fantastic trip thanks to a fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Historic location”
Reviews.Author: jag552
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night with my wife, we had appointment with US Embassy. When I booked online I did not realise that the hotel was so close to Checkpoint Charlie! Just had time for a quick look at that. Hotel was easily reached by car. Parking available in underground car park, about 8 Euros. Reception was quite friendly. The room, reached by combination of lift and stairs, was a reasonable size and it and adjoining bathroom were clean and reasonably comfortable. A flat screen TV would have been nice. WLAN was available but at extra cost. The signal was good. I needed to print out a document and I could do that on the computer at reception, no problem. For eating out the chap at reception said that there was not a great deal of choice in the immediate area, but we met some friends and drove to Kreuzberg to eat in a Turkish restaurant. After a good nights sleep we had breakfast in the hotel which was quite good but we were a bit rushed because we had to be at the US Embassy at 9am. I suppose you could cal this a business trip, but the hotel fitted the bill nicely. By the way, don´t worry about driving in Berlin. It´s easy compared to other German cities, Munich for example.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the perfect location for touring Berlin by public transport”
Reviews.Author: brynavit
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, Friendly Staff, Superb location by Kochstraße u-bahn (subway station on U6 line). We travelled to the Angleterre Hotel from Berlin-Schonefeld airport via train to Friedrichstrasse station and then changed to the U6 subway for the short remaining journey to Kockstrasse. The journey takes less than 1 hour and can be made using an 'ABC' ticket which costs just over 6 Euro or you can buy a Berlin WelcomeCard for travelling throughout Zones ABC for periods of 48 or 72 hours. The Berlin WelcomeCard can be bought at the airport and makes travel throughout Berlin on trains, subway, buses and tram really easy. The Berlin WelcomeCard also provides discounts on many tourist attractions. I would recommend buying one if it is your first visit to Berlin. On arrival at the Hotel, we found the hotel staff exceptionally friendly and very willing to help with our basic tourism enquiries in addition to questions about the Hotel. We upgraded to a comfort suite by paying an additional 10 Euros per night but we were lucky enough to only be paying 55 Euro per night anyway (a Bargain!). The facilities in our room were excellent (even if we were paying twice the room rate I would say that) and anything further that was required such as extra pillows were provided for by reception without hesitation. Broadband was 3 Euros per hour or 15 Euros for 24 hours and could easily be switched on and off by connecting your laptop to the network cable in the room. For those without a portable device, broadband is available through the TV too. We did not have breakfast at the Hotel as we prefer to find alternatives elsewhere when in a busy city. For example, there is a simple cafe opposite the hotel that opened very early and closed at about 2am each night. Overall, I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel for anyone wishing to tour Berlin and have access to the excellent underground network on their doorstep. This will be the first Hotel we try to book when we make our next visit to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel base for exploring Berlin”
Reviews.Author: steveshute
Reviews.Content: Excellent - Staff excellent - good English and very helpful. Easy to find and within site of Checkpoint Charlie - easy trip from the Teagal Airport but understand this is closing in 2011. Hotel does not look much from the outside but inside it is very comfortable. Food great - buffet breakfast with plenty of choice. Unable to fault anything with this hotel - would definetly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “hotel was overbooked”
Reviews.Author: regulartraveleryork Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: our rooms was sold off to people willing to pay £200 a night, the price i saw they were advertising the night before we travelled, so when we got there at 6pm we were told it was fully booked and was transferred to another hotel which was ok but not as central, The bargain £70 a night we were paying which was booked 6 months in advance obviously not enough. The hotel looked ok but make sure you dont get it too cheap or at least get there early, otherwise you risk being moved miles from where you want to be, which when you have spent hours researching the immediate area is very annoying nd hen

Reviews.Title: “Great yet quiet location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Palmu
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in this hotel on the Christmas week, using it for our place to stay during our excessive shopping, christmas markets & glühwein plans. First of all, it is very easy to get to - especially if you had done your homework on Berlin's public transport. We arrived Tegel airport and searched for bus 128 to take us to Kurt-Schumacher's U-Bahn station that eventually took us to Kochstrasse station, 50 metres from the hotel. That was much appreciated on the snowy city. Kochstrasse station was one stop away from Stadtmitte, so between shopping it was fast to stop by at the hotel. We bought straight off the three-day card for public transport (some 23e each). Only on the last trip back to Tegel we were asked to show our tickets. Berlin's public transport is based on trust and let's respect that. The hotel itself was easy and good value for money. Friendly staff. Room was spacey, a bit worn, but nothing that really mattered. Pillows could've been better though. Our window was towards the yard inside, so perhaps what we lost in the view, we gained in sleeping quality. Only on the last night some music from downstairs party came through, but that was silenced early. Breakfast was standard, but plenty. All in all, our stop at Berlin went as planned and we'd love to come back with more time while some warmer time of the year (though we flew from Berlin's around minus five celsius to our home's minus 28 celsius for Christmas).

Reviews.Title: “this hotel ruined Xmas”
Reviews.Author: PJLX
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite directly with the hotel 2 weeks before our stay. We also booked breakfast and a three course dinner, intending it as a treat for Xmas. When we arrived we were told the suites had been over-booked and that we would be given a normal deluxe room. It was not clear that the room rate was to be reduced either. The staff were not very helpful or apologetic. I would not recommend this hotel at all. We walked out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Claritabelle90
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in Dec for the Christmas Markets and some sightseeing. Firstly, we flew into Schonefeld airport, which a few miles out of the center. We decided to get the train (opposite the airport) and head into the center of Berlin and then proceed to the hotel. There was approx 6/7 English people at the train station all wanting to get to Alexander Platz (most famous train station in center) and we ALL managed to get on the wrong train! None of the signs are clear, there is no information center and not one member of staff to let you know where to go. Because of this, we got royally lost for 2 hours, switching from train to bus to tram and finally taxi!! Eventually this took us to the hotel. A taxi from this airport to the hotel is about 40 euro which is MUCH more expensive than the train etc but if you get lost easily and don't know anything about the public transport, this may be the best option for you! Public transport on a whole was very confusing. You buy a ticket at the machines, stamp the tickets yourself in one of the red boxes and then board the train. After buying a ticket and noticing no one had checked we had one, and there was no need to show you had purchase one when getting off the train, we saw a window of opportunity! Beleive it or not we did not pay for more than 1 train/underground ticket while we were in Berlin! This may have been just luck, however Germany obviously puts a lot of trust in the German people to buy tickets etc...we gathered we were English so we didn't count :P Bargain haha! The hotel is located right in the center of Mitte (center) just down the road to Check Point Charlie. East Berlin is the most cultural side of Berlin so the hotel is in a perfect location. Although I have noted the benefits of public transport, everything in Berlin is well within walking distance. We did an English speaking Walking Tour and we saw everything there was to see and they were all within a few blocks of each other. Would highly reccomend a walking tour also, as many of the points of interest you would just walk past and not notice, yet these were the most important and interesting things we saw whilst in Berlin. As noted before the hotel has a perfect location, and if any English people want to take advantage of the public transport there is an underground station opposite the hotel. There is also plenty of restaurants and shops near to the hotel. The cuisine in Berlin was not the best, and looking back, we did wish we would have researched some places that were good to eat before we went, so this would be a good hint for you before you go. I have no reccomendations as there was no where I particularily liked. The hotel reception and exterior are very impressive, and did live up to its 4 stars. The rooms were all spacious and the beds were VERY comfortable however not the biggest. They charge you to use the TV and the snacks in the rooms are NOT complimentary, however the room has everything you would really need. The bathroom was ok and very clean with bath and shower and then a hair dryer (so no need to pack that). The only toiletries were a squirty thing in the bathroom that you use for both shower gel and shampoo....didn't use this haha so take your own. Also, the shower glass seperator leaks so be careful! Reception staff were helpful and they showed us how to get to alot of places. Some places of interest for us was The Jewish Museum, Walking tour which will cover most of the historical important stuff, Check Point Charlie Museum, Haulocaust Memorial and museum and the Christmas Markets. The Christmas Markets were SO pretty however extremely over priced! Nice to have a look at though. Every one in Berlin kept telling us that we should come in Summer instead because it was better so this maybe something to consider. The German people were (I hate to sound like a typical English complainer...) somewhat abrupt and was reluctant to say "please", "sorry" or "thank you", so as you can imagine being typically English it was SO FRUSTRATING!! In fact, me and my friend joked that Berlin had been created to be everything an English person would hate...not a chip in sight on any menu (haha), pushing in, everything written in German and no translation in English, no sauces other than mustard (yuck!) etc etc etc...however don't let this put you off. It gives you an excuse not to be obnoxious without feeling guilty :) Overall though, very nice hotel, very clean and in excellent location and very reasonably priced. A very good choice. Hate to repeat myself but do the walking tour! It was the best thing we did.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel at three star price”
Reviews.Author: briannamccoola
Reviews.Content: Everything you would expect from a four star hotel, but we were able to snag a great deal from expedia. Clean and warm, with very friendly helpful staff. In a great location, right near checkpoint charlie, as long as your not afraid of the metro system you are never far from all of the attractions. Our only small critisim is that the internet was not free.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, comfortable modern room, best breakfast ever! Good location”
Reviews.Author: fatcat2222
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 days from 14-18 Nov 2010. Location-wise, it is about 7-10 minutes walk from the nearest subway station, however, it doesnt feel unsafe even late at night. It is located in a pretty vibrant area with lots of nice shops and restaurants which you can simply stroll to. The reception/ conceirge is very helpful and friendly. The Breakfast spread was amazing! They had fresh breads, meatballs, smoked salmon, all sorts of delicious cereals and the coffee wasn't too bad either. The room was wonderful with modern look and feel, and the bathroom was extremly clean. The mattress was to my liking- firm and hard. Free internet access is also available at the computer desk right next to reception. Overall, I will highly recommend this hotel, I got a pretty good deal from wotif.com at 65 euros per night, and it comes with the delicious breakfast spread !

Reviews.Title: “Very good and relaxed”
Reviews.Author: jalonsof
Reviews.Content: Very clean and in a good location. Very good buffet breakfast and an excelent service. Very quite hotel with good services. The only thing that can be improved is the internet service in order to make it free, because it have no sense to pay for a service that yo have free y most hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Beds very small and uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: charlesdapper
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this hotel, so it does sadden me to have to write this. The hotel was in a great area. Very central, yet in a quiet part of the street. Public transport links are brilliant. On first sight everything seems very nice. The staff are friendly and hotel is very welcoming. Once in the room the hotel is let down by it's beds. 2 very small single beds pushed together, not even dressed as a double. When I asked I was informed that they don't do double beds. I booked the room as a double and feel I was badly mis-sold. It is a real shame, but for me the most important part of any hotel are the beds.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BrianMat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and found the hotel excellent value. The location is perfect, right next to Checkpoint Charlie and a large remaining section of the Wall. A short walk will get you to Unter-Den-Linden and the Brandenburg Gate. There is a U-Bahn station beside the hotel with excellent and frequent service (longest wait for a train - 5 minutes). From here you can easily access any of the many attractions the city offers. There are a couple of cafes close by where you can get breakfast at a reasonable cost. The only downside was the lack of nightlife close to the hotel for that last drink in the evening, but the bar in the hotel is fairly good.

Reviews.Title: “Has always been my favourite in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: TheChadi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this fine establishment several times over the last 5 years or so. This hotel has been one of the finest I have stayed in across Europe. The hotel is located in a very nice area, very close to Checkpoint Charlie with a metro (u-bahn) stop right outside the hotel. You are sitting right in the heart of the city with a huge police station just facing you; can't get any safer. The receptionists are always nice and polite, rooms (although a bit tight) are always very clean and fresh, and the toilets are always clean as well. I have no complaints about this hotel. The price range they offer is very reasonable and sometimes well below some other so called 4* hotels in Berlin. The only thing that you might end up paying dearly for is the Internet access. But considering what the hotel offers, location, sleep quality and pricing, adding the Internet charges if you need it on top of that keeps it affordable and still very attractive at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “great location-perfectly adequate for citybreak!”
Reviews.Author: MODireland2010
Reviews.Content: Great location and nice place. Staff very helpful and friendly. We decided to include the breakfast and it was nice- a selection of hot and cold as well as fruit cereal etc. We went to the "Unsicht Bar" which is an interesting experience though totally overpriced considering the very poor quality food that you get. It's a restaurant in pitch black (no lights etc) run by blind or partially sighted staff. It's a fun experience.Beds were v comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great to explore Berlin but negotiate a big room for comfort”
Reviews.Author: zendon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in oct 2010. Great location to explore the city on foot. You would not need to use the super efficient public transport unless you don't want to. The hotel is located less than 100m away from kochstrasse u-bahn station. Checpoint charlie is another hundred from kochstrasse. The hotel building is interesting, the rooms come in different sizes. The first one we were given based on our special expedia rate was so small, there was hardly any space to move in the room. We asked for a larger room and had to pay extra but it was worth it. Our new room even had a balcony, very spacious, high ceilings. Do not bother with breakfast in the hotel. It is too expensive and there are plenty of choices close by. My particular recommendation would be cafe am, past the check point charlie/mauer strasse corner. They have a special hot breakfast menu. The hotel was quiet, reception staff speaks english. Internet is not for free, there is a shared computer in the reception area for all customers' use. We had no problem printing our boarding card there, but it was early. The rooms are clean. Beware that they don't put toilettries into the room. You have ask for them at the reception. Hotel.restaurant is clean and the service is good but the food is below average or maybe we were unlucky.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Great location and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: nitefire
Reviews.Content: Perfect central location. 1 tube stop down from Checkpoint Charlie. Clean rooms, nice building. Friendly / helpful staff on reception. Not a rip-off either, we booked through hotels.com and got a got price. Nice cafe over the road for breakfast pastries / Juice / Coffee, if you don't fancy the hotel breakfast and want to get on your way.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michalw32
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a beautiful English building, the service was good most of the times, the location is perfect. The hotel was clean, but on the toilet there were rust stains, they should replace it... In addition, there was a problem with the water in the bath tub - first, you don't have a door but only a plastic curtain, which i found to be plain. Second, occasionally the water were getting really hot and that was not a pleasant experience. The breakfast was very nice, but we ate there only once, it is a little bit expensive. Do ask for a quiet room when you arrive, since the hotel is throwing events such as weddings, from time to time. Do not park at the hotel, there is parking near by and it's a peaty to pay them so much for that. All and all it was nice.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels Ive stayed at in Europe”
Reviews.Author: markscura
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Angleterre Hotel for 10 nights at the end of a European trip. I would have to say it was a pleasent suprise. The staff were fantastic. The hotel is georgeous the hotel is close to everything. I cant think of one thing to complain about. I dont know what other people want but I thought this place had everything. The commonweath bar was lovely especially Marcus behind the bar he was a fun guy and very knowledgable. I would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “great location! but disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: Gemma_B72
Reviews.Content: It all started with an apparently (as stated by the hotel) a 1.6km walk from hauptbahnhof- was much longer and we ended up hailing a taxi. Room and bathroom small, but clean. Disappointing for a 4 star hotel to not stock the usuals- shampoo, soap etc and then you have to ask at reception, and as being handed over the shampoo being told "this is our last one" Reception staff not overly helpful or knowledgeable. Restaurant staff ok- not great - i.e. they would not automatically refill breakfast items that had been finished (like juice, maple syrup). We would have to ask and then the staff acted like it was a pain to have to refill things-and they'd take 15minutes! Or we were simply told "there is no more juice". Breakfast was ok but as they would not keep bringing food out I would recommend getting there early so you don't miss out on smoked salmon and croissants! Everything extra came at a charge- fitness centre 10 euro per day; wi-fi extra; ironing service (there is no ironing facilities in the room) is extra. Was great being close to public transport (the U bahn is literally a 20 metre walk from hotel). And it's very close to checkpoint charlie which was convenient. It felt like the hotel was trying to make as much money (or maybe to not lose as much money??) as possible and this had been reinforced to staff to push all the extras (e.g. the receptionist was very reluctant to tell me where a nearby laundromat was- it took me 15 minutes of probing to get the name of anything- he eventually told me where a drycleaning service was so I went and was then given directions to a laundromat in Oranienberger Tor by a very helpful German lady who had good English!) Overall it was ok but I would not stay here if I returned to Berlin and would not recommend it based on value and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient but sterile”
Reviews.Author: Ballastplough
Reviews.Content: Hotel Anleterre's location is very convenient (100 yards from Checkpoint Charlie); it is clearly run with efficiency and competence; but for my money it lacked any warmth or character. The room was flawless and the hotel was spotless, but one meal in the clinical 'Speakers' Corner' restaurant was enough. Angleterre manages to be just south of the point where Friedrichstrasse loses its glitz and buzz. It certainly did what it said on the tin and I had no complaint, but on returning to Berlin I would look for somewhere a bit more fun.

Reviews.Title: “1st Class hotel with great service great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Tommy2449
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 5 day break in Berlin The Angletrre was everything I could wish for. Staff were all very good and was at hand to help in any way they could., the location was great just up the road from Check Point Charlie and opposite the U bahn (tube) Station Koch Strasser. Room was very good and had a safe for your valuables and the breakfast gave a good variaty. If and when I visit again I would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “I would think about next time”
Reviews.Author: dingemak
Reviews.Content: Our first contact with the staff was not that pleasant: the hotel was overbooked so they placed us for one night to an "upgraded" room and next day we had to change. None of the two rooms had a double bed, only twin-bed rooms available. The location is nice, it takes not more than 20mins walk to the city center. The quality of breakfast was really high, though the breakfast room was too small for the number of guests: it was common to wait standing until somebody else leaves. Due to the high number of guests and the small buffet, food was available only for seconds... The most annoying thing: the hotel offers its facilities for external birthday parties or weddings, etc. On two of the three days of our holiday, it was impossible to relax and sleep due to the noise. There is practically no insulation and when the door of the ball room opens (and this happens several times a minute) then you can listen to the music band as if you were present to the party.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant staff in this well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: yorkspuds
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the Angleterre in Berlin in July 2010. Despite the façade, this is a modern hotel. On arrival at 8pm, and despite booking months ago, we were told that no standard room (as booked) was available. They put us in a ‘superior’ room on the 8th floor – if we wanted to remain in this room for the whole of our stay, then it would be an extra €40 per night. This was a no-brainer having paid not much more than this per night for a standard – so we opted to move the next day. It was irritating that a standard wasn’t available, and that we had to move rooms - we wondered if this was some sort of ploy to get us to pay more! The standard room was absolutely fine and the only difference appeared to be a larger hall-way and a tea & coffee making tray, but everything else, including the bathroom was exactly the same. Other than this niggle, we had a great stay here. The room was spotlessly clean and despite our being there during the World Cup, we never heard any noise. The bathroom is compact, but functional. Shampoo/shower gel was from a wall mounted dispenser (not posh stuff, but it did the job) and a soap dispenser for the sink (not seen that before!). There’s also a pretty decent hair dryer in the bathroom. As other posters have said, it is next to the U-bahn Kochstrasse station (U6 line), which gives easy access to the rest of the (absolutely brilliant) public transport network. Breakfast was part of our deal and was good and plentiful , everything being replenished promptly as and when required. All the staff that we encountered, including the front desk and breakfast staff, were charming and helpful. As mentioned above, the Berlin public transport system is something we can only dream about. Fast, efficient, clean and cheap – we used all of it – U Bahn/S Bahn, bus and tram for getting around. We would recommend that you purchase the 48 / 72 hour tickets (depending on length of your stay), which are a bargain. We purchased the Berlin Welcome Card 72 hour card for €25.90 (for zones A,B & C), as it gained entry to some museums etc as well as all of the public transport, including from the airport – Schonefeld, Zone C. We reckon we saved a fortune – go to Berlin tourist website for more details. It’s also easy to get from the airport to the hotel using this card. We bought our Card at the airport, then caught the Airport Express. If you are staying at the Angleterre, you can catch either the RB14 or the RE7 train at the airport – signed ‘Airport Express’ – and it takes around 20 minutes to get to the centre of Berlin. We got off at Friedrichstrasse, and then changed to U6 line (get on U-bahn train with destination Mariandorf) and get off at Kochstrasse – hotel virtually next to the station. Much better than spending many Euros on a taxi and so easy. Would happily stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “a lot of fun for little money”
Reviews.Author: yahho31
Reviews.Content: Everything was just perfect! Especially breakfast. I will definitely stay here again. The only thing is the TV, I would by the modern one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, and they leave gummy bears on your pillow”
Reviews.Author: cjr83
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, quiet, clean hotel in a great location--really close to Checkpoint Charlie. There is a U-bahn (subway) stop just outside of the hotel, and Friedrichstrasse has many coffee shops, cafes, and stores. The rooms are clean and modern minimalist...they look very "businesslike" if that makes sense. Bathrooms are nice with towel warmers :) There is a small glass shower "door" that covers only half of the tub so you have to be careful or everything will get wet! Just a minor detail though, otherwise a great place!! And they leave Haribo gummy bears on your pillow instead of chocolate :)) This hotel would be great for a business trip, older couples, or families. Young couples or people looking for a hip, chic, plush, or romantic place may want something else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TLMacc
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located next to a Kochstrasse U-Bahn station (easy access to all parts of the city) and walking distance to main sights around Friedrichstrasse. The hotel was of a good standard with comfortable rooms. we booked on a B&B tarriff and were happy with the variety of choices available, it was a good start to the day. I will definatley stay here again on my next trip to Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Excellent with one reservation”
Reviews.Author: harveyharvey
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location just 50 yards from the U-bahn station Kochstrasse so that made getting about the city a doddle. Also why spend 35 euros or more on a cab from the airport when you get there by train for only a couple of euros. It's at the posher end of Kreuzberg in a wide and quiet street. Rooms were very comfortable and clean. Staff were friendly and helpful. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel as I think that you are a bit cocooned in any hotel and having breakfast with the locals in a nearby cafe is a good way to get into the feel of a place. We arrived early in the day and our Standard room wasn't going to be ready till three in the afternoon but for 10 euros a night extra we could upgrade to a Comfort room and take it straight away. As we had been up for a very early flight this seemed a good idea. Quite honestly I don't know how much difference there is between Standard and Comfort but we were delighted with what we got. We didn't eat in the hotel restaurant as there never seemed to be anyone else in it so can't say what the food was like: that's a pity as I had a look in and it was a very stylish space. Our one problem was that we were on the top floor and on our last night it rained; water from the roof dripped onto a little ledge outside the window and the constant drip sounded like you were in a caravan in th middle of a rainstorm. It kept us awake half the night. There were a number of good restaurants nearby, especially an Italian called Sale e Tabachi just round the corner in Rudi Deutch St - recmmend that you book.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: LaoisS
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel, staff very helpful and couldn't be nicer. Rooms were clean and spacious. The location for us was perfect near check point Charlie - the Brandenburg gate etc close by. rail/underground a few yards away for the hotel. A nice area if you enjoy a peaceful nights Sleep, plenty of bars and restaurants near by. We would recommend this hotel to others

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel - Easy transfer to Tegel airport”
Reviews.Author: J&B_isleofwight
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights B&B just before Christmas. We were very pleased with our room which was very spacious, well appointed with effective A.C. and heating. The room had large twin beds placed together which were incredibly comfortable. The bathroom was top quality. Breakfast was very good with a wide choice. It is served in a long narrow dining room. By the time we got down each day all tables were taken apart from a couple near the window overlooking the street. It was -18 outside and these tables were a bit chilly and thus not so popular. The staff put in extra heaters here but they were fighting a losing battle! There is a cosy bar with good happy hour cocktails. Cosy until someone walked in from the street with the accompanying bitter blast! The enchanting Gendarmen Christmas Market was within ten minutes walk and all the other Christmas Markets were within easy reach by the underground. It was lovely to see these under snow. The main Unter Den Linden area is about a 20 min walk away but in those temperatures we found it best to go there by the underground. We had an excellent meal at the Entrecote Restaurant and good cheap pub food and beer at Maximillans. Both are within a five minute walk. The Hotel is well sited for Tegel Airport. There is an underground station within a few yards of the Hotel with a direct line to Jacob Kaiser Platz. From there you catch the free bus for the short ride to Tegel Airport. We highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Barkerk2610
Reviews.Content: Angleterre Hotel 3 days, Nov 09. Hotel well maintained, clean and tidy. Good location for tourists, safe. Large spacious, clean room, very quiet. Front desk staff very helpful. Whilst advertising FREE high speed internet on Trip Advisor, this is NOT available and internet access has to be paid for. Stayed on a Bed & Breakfast basis - restaurant nice, spotless, good food. Would certainly recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A good-value, good-location hotel with character”
Reviews.Author: Mr-Tea-O-P
Reviews.Content: It's nice to be able to stay in a moderately priced, well located hotel that also has character. Although our room was in a new-ish wing, it's attached to a good-looking, well-maintained old hotel. Breakfasts are pricey--we didn't try them, but the hotel restaurant served us a very good dinner at a price that was not cheap, but not excessive. There are some deals, too: "happy hour" discounts, and in our case a $10/day food voucher that was part of the room package. So ask. The room was pleasant and a good size, with good bathroom facilities. Nothing is free here (gym, wireless..), but it's available. The location is not right in the center of things (unless you're aiming for Checkpoint Charlie, just up the street, which does have a very interesting outdoor Berlin Wall exhibit), but it's not far from the main attractions, and is right next to a U-bahn stop, and about 10 mins walk to another that serves a different line, so access to everywhere is no problem. A good choice, we felt.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location near to key sites.”
Reviews.Author: Brian-Angela
Reviews.Content: The location and value for money were excellent. Rooms are modern, very clean, comfortable and had all facilities one could want including air con. Garage parking is limited so really must book a space in advance. Reception area is off-putting but this merely hides a very efficient modern city hotel. Within walking distance of many essential visitor sites and underground station is virtually outside front entrance so no problem with getting about. Good eateries just up the road if you don't fancy the hotel dining room. Would certainly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice and value”
Reviews.Author: martin66
Reviews.Content: Stayed three days at the Angleterre on my first visit to Berlin. The location (near the touristy but interesting Checkpoint Charlie) is good although a short bus/subway ride from the major Mitte sites. Rooms are modern and very comfortable. AC keeps the room at a reasonable temperature on hot German summer days. Service is professional and the prices make this a very good value. Angleterre makes a good base from which to explore this sensational city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel and a superb location.”
Reviews.Author: Toby-Storm
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my girlfriend in August (after seeing the reviews on the website) and was, in truth, due to the pictures of the previous reviews, expecting to see a slightly old fashioned hotel. What we got was a modern, very clean hotel with friendly and efficient staff who seemed to take please in helping us in every way. On arrival we were given a local map of the area and were recommended areas to eat and drink. Our room was on the 8th floor which can be accessed by the lift using our door key (card), which itself turned the lights etc on and off as we entered and left the room (so no worries about leaving the iron on, etc). The room was very tidy and clean with a safe and hairdryer as promised, the bathroom was again spotless and the shower was easy to use and hot/warm or cold was easily mixed. The room opened onto an internal courtyard, (with sliding doors and a balcony rail), which was very quiet at all times, in fact we never heard anybody and only saw signs of life when in reception even though the hotel was busy. The room had aircon, which if I was being fussy was slightly loud but we got used to it very quickly. When signing out we were asked if we had bought anything from the food/drink cabinet in the room (which we didn't) and we were told everything was fine and thanked for our visit. As our flight was not until 3.45pm and the room was to be vacated at 12pm, the receptionist allowed us to store our bag, without charge, in a designated room until later which allowed us a few more hours in Berlin. The hotel also booked our taxi to the airport. Also, very importantly, the hotel is opposite a police station. We never heard or saw any trouble whilst we were there, not just because of the poilce station but because its just a great, friendly place were we walked the streets at midnight without worry. Finally, as I mentioned it being a great location, if you turn right out of the hotel and walk 250 metres you end up at Check Point Charlie and the underground which takes you anywhere in the city very efficiently and safetly. The shops, coffee bars and pubs are superb with english speaking staff who again are friendly and efficient. I would recommend Maximillians pub on the Friedrichstraße (the road outside the hotel leading towards and past CPC), just look for a large statue of a fat man in lederhosen! Great beer and food - try the currywurst. One last thing, go on a boat trip. You will see loads of beautiful buildings and it will give you ideas where to visit as there are lots of 'hidden' bars along the river that we did not see from the main road. 10 out of 10, for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, convenient for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: george7mc
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late as our flight was delayed. The staff were friendly and welcoming. We were told our room had been upgraded free of charge, as they were very busy(?). The room itself was on the 6th floor with a balcony, and views of the police station opposite, and Checkpoint Charlie down the road. It was spacious and nicely decorated. The bed was 2 single beds pushed together with single duvets, but I have to say it was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. We booked room only and were offered breakfast for 16 euros which I thought was a bit pricey. Also the mini bar in the room was very expensive so was left untouched. The bathroom was clean. The only real downside was the lack of tea/coffee making facilities, but as Starbucks is just down the road, this wasn't too much of a problem. It was a great base for sightseeing, and only a few meters from the u-bahn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value, Great Food!”
Reviews.Author: DINKEtravellers
Reviews.Content: Our party was three middle aged women and our mother, we made our booking for this hotel on the internet via third party and got a really good deal. Based on some of the reviews and the amount we paid we were honestly expecting a hotel a bit past it's prime and yet the hotel was very modern looking, the rooms were well furnished. We arrived very late on a Friday night and so were allocated the last two available rooms, one on the front of the hotel and one at the back. To be honest even though we were at the front on Friederichstrasse there was very little noise. I think that we had one of the smallest rooms in the hotel but, even so it was very nice. We only had one issue and that was the room smelled of cigarette smoke. Booking on line we could not specify none smoking but, I would recommend this if you are able. There is a really good Italian restaurant just around the corner that is open until 2am so if you arrive late as we did: Sale e Tabacchi‎. The breakfast in the hotel was really good - tea and coffee served to the table and the rest buffet style, there was a good hote section and lots of bread, cereal, meats and cheese, pastries etc. The bar was very good although you do have to go outside to access it, quite pricey as well.

Reviews.Title: “nice, spacious suite, would recommend to fellow travelers”
Reviews.Author: canwetalk
Reviews.Content: Angleterre Hotel 6 days. July 2009. Building presented as well coordinated historic & new spaces, well maintained & tidy. Great location for tourists - seemed safe at nite. Stayed in suite 4th floor historic wing - charming, spacious & clean rooms, large windows overlooking street, pleased w/ hot water available 24/7, thrilled w/ quiet rooms - didn't hear another occupant entire stay. Was quite comfortable at hotel throughout. Would rate hotel a strong 3 star qualifier. All about it very nice, not extravagant. Front desk staff seems to lack organization & communication from shift to shift - suspect that's the reason for booking problems of other travelers in reviews - would suggest several phone calls pre-arrival to confirm reservation specifics. Surprised despite advertisements/pics, there is only 1 room in building w/ hardwood floors. All staff seemed fluent English-speaking. Highly recommend purchase of media package if travelers plan using TV/internet in any even small amount - no wi-fi in rooms. At all hours there seemed to be someone using the 1 computer in lobby provided by hotel for guests. Hotel restaurant - pleasant, good food. Small store across street convenient, friendly staff. Shuttle service to airport recommended by hotel prompt/reliable. Would recommend this hotel to others & would stay there again ourselves if ever to return to Berlin. On that note, recommend much shorter stay for tourists - were completely out of things to see in 4 days. Strongly Not recommend Checkpoint Charlie Museum near hotel - sadly, most poorly organized/presented exhibition in world w/ quite an admission fee.

Reviews.Title: “loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: threat
Reviews.Content: Staff was very helpful and friendly. Location is great -- right next to Check Point Charlie, subway, and dining. Rooms are very comfortable and very clean. What else to say? Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Well located”
Reviews.Author: NJHoya
Reviews.Content: Certainly not a 4 star hotel in terms of US standards but very nice nonetheless. Located about 200 meters from Checkpoint Charlie (one of the more famous East/West Berlin borders). Rooms were nicely furnished and clean with Television and internet. Staff spoke perfect English. Free computer with printing in the lobby. Fitness center on the top floor. Hotel also has its own restaurant that provides room service. For the price, certainly more than worth it.

Reviews.Title: “recommended”
Reviews.Author: donstefano
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are actually very new, despite the bbuilding's looks from the outside. I stayed in a very quiet room, with good facilities. A real surprise given that I only paid 87 euro for a night in the middle of the week. Good location. Friendly staff as well. If you arrive by public transport, print a map first, because the house numbering system in Berlin is very confusing - I first ended up at the wrong side of Friedrichstrasse, which is a long way to walk.... (it's close to checkpoint Charlie)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in central Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Rob I
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights whilst attending a conference in Berlin. The hotel has a beautiful facade on one of the main streets in central Berlin. It's quiet and very friendly. The staff spoke perfect English and were consistently happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “well located good value”
Reviews.Author: canuckbioteach
Reviews.Content: 30 meters from Subway system (U Bahn) Station KochstraBe on line U6 which is the stop for Checkpoint Charlie. We were in a comfort room and our rate included the very nice buffet breakfast in their Speakers corner resturant. Nearby are several good resturants. In fact two stops away on U6 at Mehringdamm stop and two block further down is a bustling area with a great diversity of good resturants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in fab city”
Reviews.Author: scarlet102
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay in this hotel and both times we have been very impressed. The hotel is in a good location near to Checkpoint Charlie and is within a 30 second walk of the underground. The hotel has a nice reception area with lovely chandliers and wall paintings.
